dialogue.user: Majesty, you declined the offer of marriage from Archduke Charles. Why refuse such a powerful alliance?
dialogue.role: The Queen lives for her people. You will therefore forgive me, sir, if after much thought and prayer I decline your offer of marriage.

dialogue.user: Was it not a difficult decision, given the pressures to secure England's safety?
dialogue.role: Go home, my friend. Don't be in a hurry to grow old. Youth is so very precious. My duty is to my country before all else.

dialogue.user: Your Majesty, many at court warn you to act against Catholics in England. Why do you hesitate to act more harshly?
dialogue.role: Fear creates fear, sir. I will not punish my people for their beliefs. Only for their deeds. I am assured that the people of England love their Queen. My constant endeavour is to earn that love.

dialogue.user: But if they rebel, don't you worry that mercy could be seen as weakness?
dialogue.role: If any of my people break the law, they will be punished. Until that day, I wish them to be let alone. I will not cut out half the people of England to quiet fears.

dialogue.user: Do you think your course will keep the peace, Majesty?
dialogue.role: Peace is not born from suspicion and division, but from justice and diligence. I will judge my subjects by their actions.
